info.title: OpManager Plus REST API
info.description: REST API for OpManager Plus - Network monitoring and management solution. This API allows integration with 3rd party IT management/service desk software.

get.description: Lists all the alarms generated in OpManager Plus.

parameters.name: deviceName
parameters.description: Device Name of the alarm. The device name can be taken from the URL of the device snapshot page.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Severity of the alarm. The severity could range anywhere from 1 to 5. 1 = Critical, 2 = Trouble, 3 = Attention, 4 = Service Down, 5 = Clear .

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Device category of the alarm

parameters.name: alertType
parameters.description: alertType of the alarm. The alert type can be any of the following: ActiveAlarms, EventLogAlarms, SyslogAlarms, TrapAlarms, NCMAlarms, NFAAlarms, WebAlarms, FWAAlarms, StorageAlarms .

parameters.name: fromTime
parameters.description: Start time for the custom time period range. It could be of the format yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss. If no time is specified (i.e, yyyy-mm-dd format), the default time will be set to 12 A.M(start of the day).

parameters.name: toTime
parameters.description: End time for the custom time period range. It could be of the format yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss. If no time is specified (i.e, yyyy-mm-dd format), the default time will be set to 12 A.M(start of the day).

parameters.name: probeName
parameters.description: The name of the Probe. The probe name could be obtained by executing the listProbes API , where the parameter name in the response refers to the probeName. [Applicable only for Central Server]

get.description: Fetches the Availability graphs for the given device or interface.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the device or interface - Managed Entity name as seen in the URL of device/interface snapshot page OR 'deviceName' property value of listDevices API or 'interfaceName' property value in the listInterfaces API response [Example: opmserver.mydomain.com or IF-xx.xx.24.223-115]

parameters.description: Set instance=Interface if the Availability graph is requested for the interface. Mandatory field if the interface data is being fetched. This API can also be used to fetch availability of other monitors. [Example: Interface|URL|winService|service|process]

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Edit will be sent by default (Edit).

parameters.name: MS_INSTANCEID
parameters.description: Downtime scheduler ID.

parameters.name: scheduleId
parameters.description: Downtime scheduler ID.

parameters.name: scheduleName
parameters.description: Downtime scheduler name.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status will be set as Enabled by default.

parameters.name: scheduleDesc
parameters.description: Downtime scheduler description.

parameters.name: recurrence
parameters.description: Downtime frequency (OnceOnly | Daily | Weekly | Monthly).

parameters.name: selectDevicesMethod
parameters.description: Filter by option (Category | BV | Device | URL | GROUP).

parameters.name: selectedCateg
parameters.description: Selected category.

parameters.name: selectedDevices
parameters.description: Selected devices.

parameters.name: selectedBV
parameters.description: Selected Business View.

parameters.name: selectedURL
parameters.description: Selected URLs.

parameters.name: selectedLogicalGroup
parameters.description: Selected logical group.

parameters.name: once_startat
parameters.description: Start time (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm).

parameters.name: once_endat
parameters.description: End time (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm).

parameters.name: from_time
parameters.description: Start time (hh:mm) for Daily downtime frequency.

parameters.name: to_time
parameters.description: End time (hh:mm) for Daily downtime frequency.

parameters.name: daily_effectfrom
parameters.description: Effect from date (yyyy-mm-dd) for Daily downtime frequency.

parameters.name: startday
parameters.description: Start day (Sunday | Monday | Tuesday | Wednesday | Thursday | Friday | Saturday) for Weekly downtime frequency.

parameters.name: endday
parameters.description: End day (Sunday | Monday | Tuesday | Wednesday | Thursday | Friday | Saturday) for Weekly downtime frequency.

parameters.name: from_time
parameters.description: Start time (hh:mm) for Weekly downtime frequency.

parameters.name: to_time
parameters.description: End time (hh:mm) for Weekly downtime frequency.

parameters.name: monthlyType
parameters.description: Monthly downtime type (monthlyDate | monthlyDay).

parameters.name: startday
parameters.description: Start day (month date, 32 for the last day of the month) for Monthly date-wise frequency.

parameters.name: endday
parameters.description: End day (month date, 32 for the last day of the month) for Monthly date-wise frequency.

parameters.name: from_mins
parameters.description: Start minute (00 to 59) for Monthly date-wise frequency.

parameters.name: to_mins
parameters.description: End minute (00 to 59) for Monthly date-wise frequency.

parameters.name: from_hrs
parameters.description: Start hour (00 to 23) for Monthly date-wise frequency.

parameters.name: to_hrs
parameters.description: End hour (00 to 23) for Monthly date-wise frequency.

parameters.name: weekOfMonth
parameters.description: Week of the month (1-5 or last week) for Monthly day-wise frequency.

parameters.name: weekday
parameters.description: Day of the week (Sunday | Monday | Tuesday | Wednesday | Thursday | Friday | Saturday) for Monthly day-wise frequency.

parameters.name: from_mins
parameters.description: Start minute (00 to 59) for Monthly day-wise frequency.

parameters.name: to_mins
parameters.description: End minute (00 to 59) for Monthly day-wise frequency.

parameters.name: from_hrs
parameters.description: Start hour (00 to 23) for Monthly day-wise frequency.

parameters.name: to_hrs
parameters.description: End hour (00 to 23) for Monthly day-wise frequency.

post.description: Manage or Unmanage the devices,interfaces or URL monitors that are currently added in OpManager Plus.

parameters.name: manage
parameters.description: Enables monitoring of devices or interfaces if manage=true, disables monitoring if manage=false

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the device or interface. (Managed Entity name as seen in the URL of device/interface snapshot page OR 'deviceName' property value in the listDevices API response)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Set type as 'INTERFACE' if the managed entity is an interface. Set type as 'URL' if the managed entity is an Url monitor.

parameters.name: isInterface
parameters.description: This parameter will take effect only when the value 'INTERFACE' is supplied to type param. Set the value for this param as 'true' if the managed entity is an interface. By default, the entity will be assumed as device, hence it is not required to pass this parameter for managing device.

get.description: Lists all the devices added in OpManager Plus.

parameters.name: isFluidic
parameters.description: Set value as 'true' by default.(for internal purpose)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Fetches the list of devices that fall under the given Device Type. [Example: type=Cisco2081]

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Fetches the list of devices that fall under the given device category [Example: Server, Switch, etc.]

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Fetches the list of devices that have the given App in it and monitored in OpManager Plus [Example: MSSQL, Exchange, Domain Controller]

parameters.name: bvName
parameters.description: Fetches the list of devices that are under the given Business View map name

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Fetches the list of devices that have the given vendor name.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: Filter devices by protocol [Example: all|SNMP|WMI|CLI|VIWebService|VIWMI|CLI|XenService|PrismAPI|NetAppAPI|SMI]

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Filter devices by severity [Example: 1 (Critical), 2 (Trouble), 3 (Attention), 4 (service down), 5 (Clear), 7 (Unmanaged)]

parameters.name: selectedVTypes
parameters.description: Filter devices by Virtual device type [Example: VMware-VM|VMware-Host|HyperV-VM|Xen-VM|VMware-vCenter|Xen-Host|HyperV-Host]

parameters.name: groupName
parameters.description: Filter devices by Group name

parameters.name: customFields
parameters.description: To fetch custom field values for the devices, supply the required custom field names in the 'customFields' param in the API request. Example: /api/json/device/listDevices?apiKey=***************&customFields=Building,Comments,Floor

parameters.name: getInterfaces
parameters.description: To fetch devices with associated interfaces. Boolean value: TRUE/FALSE

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: To fetch devices in batches. This should be combinedly used with 'rows' parameter. [Example: page=1, rows=200, page=2, rows=200]

parameters.name: rows
parameters.description: To fetch devices in batches. This should be combinedly used with 'page' parameter [Example: page=1, rows=200, page=2, rows=200]

parameters.name: sortByType
parameters.description: Defining sort type to be ascending or descending  [Example, sortByType=asc Or sortByType=desc]

parameters.name: sortByColumn
parameters.description: Sorting device list by columns [Example: displayName, interfaceCount, ipaddress, type, etc.]

application/json.example: {"total ":1,"page ":1,"rows ":[{"isSNMP ":true,"ipaddress ":"127.0.0.1 ","statusStr ":"Critical ",""prettyTime ":"10 minutes ago ","displayName ":"OPMRouterDevice ","isNew ":false,"type ":"Cisco 2900 IS Series ","vendorName ":"Cisco ","deviceName ":"127.0.0.1 ","statusNum ":"1 ","addedTime ":"28 Nov 2022 01:08:41 PM IST ","interfaceCount ":14,"category ":"Router "},{"isSNMP ":false,"ipaddress ":"127.0.0.1 ","statusStr ":"Clear ","prettyTime ":"50 minutes ago ","displayName ":"OPMSwitch_Site1 ","isNew ":false,"type ":"Unknown ","vendorName ":"Unknown ","deviceName ":"127.0.0.1 ","statusNum ":"5 ","addedTime ":"28 Nov 2022 12:29:06 PM IST ","interfaceCount ":0,"category ":"Unknown "}],"records ":2}

get.description: Provides the Hardware Informations of a device

parameters.name: deviceName/ipAddress/dnsName
parameters.description: Either one of these three parameters can be used to retrieve the device details. These parameters are the managed Entity name as seen in the URL of the device snapshot page (OR 'deviceName' property value in the listDevices API response), or the IP address of the device, or the DNS name of the device.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key

post.description: API to update the Hardware Information of any device.

parameters.name: deviceName/ipAddress/dnsName
parameters.description: Either one of these three parameters can be used to update the device details. These parameters are the managed Entity name as seen in the URL of the device snapshot page (OR 'deviceName' property value in the listDevices API response), or the IP address of the device, or the DNS name of the device.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: The JSON array containing metricName and metricValue for Hardware details update: (a) metricName - The Hardware metric(s) that need to be changed. These metrics include Model, SoftwareVersion, OperatingSystem, RAM, HDD, and Manufacturer. [Note: These metrics are case-sensitive and must be used as it is] (b) metricValue - The value corresponding to the respective metricName to be changed.
